page.title: 01Introduction to Holwell
page.content: The area comprises{Pulham}village and parts of the villages of{Holwell and{Glanvilles Wootton. } It lies in the Blackmore Vale,six or seven miles south east of Sherborne It is administered by West Dorset District Council.The populations of the villages in 1981 were{Pulham 163, {Holwell 356}and{Glanvilles Wootton {194;}- not all of these folk live in the surveyed area. The heavy clay soils produce a rich pasture and dairy farming is predominant. Whilst there is some employment in agriculture,nearby towns provide most of the jobs. State education is provided at Bishop's Caundle & Buckland Newton,and from 11+ in Sherborne.There is a small independent primary school in Holwell.
